Seventeen diseases are now preventable through vaccines routinely administered to children and adults in the United States ( [Table 118-1](#hpim20_ch118tb1)), and most vaccine-preventable diseases of childhood are at historically low levels ( [Table 118-2](#hpim20_ch118tb2)). Health care providers deliver the vast majority of vaccines in the United States in the course of providing routine health services and therefore play an integral role in the nation's public health system.
